args:
Erasmus has long been vying with a dangerous
fiend named Barbary for a legendary hidden
treasure. But after the prince offers his aid,
Barbary steals the prize and grows to a
colossal size.
That should be the last of them.
What the heck is a fiend with an\notherworld fragment doing here?!

They're powerful shards that are dropped
by equally powerful fiends. The strong
mana inside them can be used to bend
and warp the fabric of space itself.
...But back to our conversation, Erasmus.\nYou say someone is targeting you?
Before I answer that, I would put to you a\nquestion of my own. Who are you people,\nand why have you come to this place?
We're following a treasure map.\nEr, or a map, at any rate.
And how did you come by this map?
It washed up on shore in a bottle.\nHere, take a look for yerself.
...This is Simon's map that he lost on\nthe beach some time ago! To think it\nhas finally made its way back here...

Despite him being a skilled adventurer,
Simon had no sense of direction at all.
He needed this map just to find his way
to my abode.
Heh. How amusing. I have not thought\nupon this matter for an age.
It sounds like you and Simon were close.
Wait, so this AIN'T a treasure map?!\nIt's just to help out some poor schmo\nwhat gets lost all the time?!
Oh, there might be more to it than all that.

At the end of my adventure with Simon,
we came into possession of a treasure—
a legendary piece which enhances the
mana of its owner.
We sealed it here and set traps\nto protect it, and I have kept guard\never since.
So that's what the traps were for!
Er, but back to the treasure. Do you think\nwe could...maybe...take a peek at it?
Alas, I no longer know its location.
I thought you were guarding it!
And I would be still, if not for\nthat foul villain Barbary.
The archenemy of Simon and myself.\nWe—and now just I—have long been\nwaging war with her over the treasure.
Just a few years ago, she learned of my\nlocation and attacked with her minions.
The fiends we found all over\nthe island, you mean?
Just so. Barbary came under cover of\na raging storm and made off with the\ntreasure while I was distracted.
I chased her down, and we did battle\non the high seas. But alas, the treasure\nitself was lost in our struggle.
Sunk to the bottom of the sea, eh?\nThat's a downer, all right.
Barbary was furious to have lost it,\nand sought to force me to use my power\nin order to locate it once more.
But I would never aid her in this quest,\nand so hid myself away inside this cave.
It sounds like you could use\nour help, Erasmus.
We can't allow a dangerous fiend to find\nthe treasure and use it for evil.
This is not your matter;\nI cannot accept your aid.
Ah, but it IS our matter! It can't be mere\ncoincidence for us to have found a map\nthat led us all the way here!
I think Simon wanted us to have it.
In truth, I have been troubled at my\ninability to search for the treasure alone.\nMy power is to guide others, you see.
Thanks to your cooperation, I will finally\nbe able to search for it.
Yeah, break out the magical guide beams\nor whatever and let's goooo!
I will do exactly that. Behold...
O, flame! By your radiant incandescence,\nI bid thee guide the lost and show the way.\nBe their lantern in the dark!
Now we merely go in the direction\nthe flame points—which appears\nto be the eastern side of the isle.
...We have arrived. The treasure will be\nsomewhere in that rocky area.
I can't believe I'm FINALLY gonna\ntrack down some treasure!
While treasure holds no interest for me,\nI am happy to lend my aid to Erasmus.
By the way, what IS this treasure, exactly?
It is a ball small enough to be held in a\nperson's hand, inlaid in a setting modeled\nafter a dragon's claw.
Something that small will likely\nprove difficult to find.
Yeah, but won't Erasmus's magic fire\ndealie point us right to it?
Merely a bit tired. My power demands a\nrather extreme amount of mana, you see.
Then stop using it and rest!
You've taken us all the way here—\nwe can handle this part.
Heck, a treasure ain't worth squat unless\nya dig it up with yer own two hands.
Right. Let us do the lookin'\nwhile you do the restin'.
My apologies. I will leave it to you.
Let's split up and search this area.
...No luck on this end. Anyone else?
Nope—and I feel like we've searched\njust about everywhere.
The thing might be hidin' in the shadows\nof one'a these stones, so what say we\nshove 'em aside? ...HHHNNNGGGGHH!
Aaaand a big goose egg. Shoulda known.
Yeah, but I think you've got the right idea.\nC'mon, everyone! Push the rocks!
Hnngggh! ...Nothing? Very well, then.\nOn to the next.
I'm not exactly one for manual labor,\nbut I suppose the situation calls for it.\n...Heave! Ho!
Hmm... Now THIS looks like a fine place\nfor treasure to be hiding. Hnnngh!
Bwaaa ha ha! Yeah, that tends to\nhappen on the underside'a rocks.
Avast, ye land-lubbin' maggot!\nYe be some sharp little runts\nto be figurin' ol' Barbary out!
What are you doing here, demon?!
Gahar har har! I been followin' ye,\nand ye led me right to me treasure!
She be mine now—so tie yer tongues\nand toss me the goods!
This belongs to Erasmus and Simon!
To steal something so precious is the\nmost unforgivable of sins!
The path of righteousness must be\npreached, even to fiends like you!
Gahar har har! I spit on yer righteousness!\nI be a pirate, ye hollow-headed lass!\nStealin' be what we do!
Then it looks as though this calls for\na more forceful method of persuasion!
And how do ye plan to fight with yer\nrags slippin' off and showin' yer hidden\ntreasures to the world?!
Your swimsuit is fine, Estelle!\nBarbary's trying to trick you!
Gahar har har! Ye stone-headed lass!\nOutwittin' ye was as simple as pointin'\na ship true north under clear skies!
Now, me sweet, grant yer power to\nol' Barbary!
Yar, THIS power be to me likin'!
Pull yourself together, Estelle!\nWe have to deal with Barbary!
And what exactly ARE we to do\nwith such a monstrous fiend?!
You hoisted something up—something that\nseemed set to repel the great beast.
(If she's right, then the thing\nI need to hoist up is...)
Yes! The otherworld fragment! We'll trap\nBarbary in the space between worlds!
That should keep the island safe for now.\nCome on, everyone! After Barbary!
